result.markdown: --- title: "Coastal Monitoring Program" --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Image by Jose R. Cabello from Pixabay](figures/under-construction.png){fig-align='center' width=960} ::: ::: This website will provide technical information on CMAR's Coastal Monitoring Program and Data Governance initiatives. The content in under development and should be considered a **DRAFT**. CMAR's Coastal Monitoring Program (CMP) is an ongoing data collection effort that aims to support and inform science-based development of Nova Scotia's marine coastal industry, guide government policy and management decisions, encourage environmental stewardship, and ensure preparedness for climate change. Content to include: - 3 branches - data access - data governance - sensor strings - CMARverse - sensors used (see DMP) - data processing - data management plan - bar plots with number of observations each year
